{{Infobox football tournament season | title = Copa del Rey | year = 1920 | other_title = | image = | imagesize = | caption = | country = Spain | num_teams = | defending champions = | champions = [[FC Barcelona]] | runner-up = [[Athletic de Bilbao]] | matches = 9 | goals = 27 | top goal scorer = | player = | prevseason = [[1919 Copa del Rey|1919]] | nextseason = [[1921 Copa del Rey|1921]] }} The '''Copa del Rey 1920''' was the 18th edition of the [[Copa del Rey]], the [[Spain|Spanish]] [[Association football|football]] cup competition. The competition started in March 1920 and concluded on May 2, 1920 with the Final, held at the [[El MolinÃ³n]] in [[Gijon]], in which [[FC Barcelona]] lifted the trophy for the 4th time ever with a 2â0 victory over [[Athletic Bilbao]]. ==Teams== * '''[[Biscay]]''': [[Athletic de Bilbao]] *'''[[Gipuzkoa]]''': [[Real UniÃ³n]] * '''Center Region''': [[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]] * '''South Region''': [[Sevilla FC]] *'''[[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]]''': [[Real Vigo Sporting]] *'''[[Asturias]]''': [[Sporting de GijÃ³n]] * '''[[Catalonia]]''': [[FC Barcelona]] ==Quarterfinals== [[Real UniÃ³n]] received a bye to the semifinals. [[Sevilla FC]] did not appear to play its qualifying matches against [[FC Barcelona]] after their proposal to play both matches in Madrid was not followed. FC Barcelona qualified for the semifinals ===First leg=== {{footballbox | date = March 28, 1920 | team1 = [[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]] | score = 1–1 | team2 = [[Athletic de Bilbao]] | stadium = [[Madrid]] }} ---- {{footballbox | date = March 28, 1920 | team1 = [[Sporting de GijÃ³n]] | score = 0–0 | team2 = [[Real Vigo Sporting]] | stadium = [[GijÃ³n]] }} ===Second leg=== {{footballbox | date = April 4, 1920 | team2 = [[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]] | score = 4–1 | team1 = [[Athletic de Bilbao]] | stadium = [[Bilbao]] }} ''Athletic de Bilbao qualified for the semifinals. ---- {{footballbox | date = March 28, 1920 | team2 = [[Sporting de GijÃ³n]] | score = 4–1 | team1 = [[Real Vigo Sporting]] | stadium = [[Vigo]] }} ''Real Vigo qualified for the semifinals. ==Semifinals== ===First leg=== {{footballbox | date = March 28, 1920 | team1 = [[Real UniÃ³n]] | score = 0–1 | team2 = [[FC Barcelona]] | stadium = [[Irun]] }} ---- {{footballbox | date = April 11, 1920 | team1 = [[Athletic de Bilbao]] | score = 2–1 | team2 = [[Real Vigo Sporting]] | stadium = [[Bilbao]] }} ===Second leg=== {{footballbox | date = April 4, 1920 | team2 = [[Real UniÃ³n]] | score = 4–4 | team1 = [[FC Barcelona]] | stadium = [[Barcelona]] }} ''FC Barcelona qualified for the final. ---- {{footballbox | date = April 18, 1920 | team2 = [[Athletic de Bilbao]] | score = 0–1 | team1 = [[Real Vigo Sporting]] | stadium = [[Vigo]] }} ''Athletic de Bilbao qualified for the final. ==Final== {{main|1920 Copa del Rey Final}} {{footballbox| date= May 2, 1920| team1= [[FC Barcelona]] | score= 2â0 | report= | team2= [[Athletic Bilbao]] | goals1= MartÃ­nez {{goal|70}}
